item.title: 150-Year-Old law revives Byron Allen's racial discrimination suit
item.description:
150-Year-Old law revives Byron Allen's racial discrimination suit

A single section from a 150-year-old law could significantly change the landscape of cable television If the budding media mogul Byron Allen has his way. The 55-year-old African-American comedian and CEO of Entertainment Studios has been waging war on traditional cable network operators for years now, and he scored a major victory recently when a U.S.

item.title: The New Edition Story
item.description:
The New Edition Story

2017 is soon approaching and there's already one thing to be very excited about - The New Edition Biopic. The trailer for the upcoming production premiered during the 16th annual BET Awards, and based on what we've seen, we will all be very very happy.

item.title: Stay Tuned: The Future of TV
item.description:
Stay Tuned: The Future of TV

The 80-year-old TV industry at the precipice of a distribution and content revolution. The widely-anticipated convergence of personal computers, the internet and television is finally happening. In the next two years, viewers in more than 140 million American homes will watch their favorite shows, video clips and movies on "Smart TVs," not to mention other gadgets connected to the Internet.
